::: callout-tip
## Objective

After this session, you should be able to implement a basic simulation for regression analysis in R and use it to test some of the hypotheses you made in you own analysis.
:::

## Materials

## Session Outline

1.  Course logistics
2.  Why do accurate estimates matters?
3.  Why are simulations useful?
4.  The overall approach to simulations
5.  Implementation in R

## Exercise

*This section will describe the exercise that we will do in class and provide links to the data sets and tools used.*

Since the TDs have not yet started, we will use Google Collabs to run today's code online. In the future, you will use R Studio.
